intro: Stevia decussata, commonly known as the clustered stevia, is a perennial shrub native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is known for its sweet-tasting leaves, which contain high concentrations of steviol glycosides, making it a natural sweetener. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its medicinal and culinary uses, it is cultivated in various regions for its health benefits and flavor.
